capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that the character Filch from Harry Potter is considered an adult. That's confirmed by most sources, and I'm certain about it.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that the character Filch from Harry Potter is considered an adult. That's confirmed by most sources, and I'm certain about it. It makes sense, given his role as a strict caretaker at Hogwarts.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've noticed that the character of Filch in our school's stories is often portrayed as a bit of an adult in a child's world. He's always so strict and serious, it's like he's trying to be a grown-up before his time. (SENTIMENT: AMUSED)

You know, I've noticed that the character of Filch in our school's history is often portrayed as a bit of an outcast. capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not sure I agree with the idea that being an adult automatically means you're old. I mean, just because someone is considered an adult in terms of age doesn't necessarily mean they're set in their ways or out of touch with what's going on. There are plenty of adults who are still young at heart and full of energy.
